info.title: Kanidm
info.description: API for interacting with the Kanidm system. This is a work in progress

post.summary: API endpoint for creating/replacing the image associated with an OAuth2 Resource Server.
post.description:
API endpoint for creating/replacing the image associated with an OAuth2 Resource Server.

It requires a multipart form with the image file, and the content type must be one of the
[VALID_IMAGE_UPLOAD_CONTENT_TYPES].

post.summary: Due to how the migrations work in 6 -> 7, we can accidentally
post.description:
Due to how the migrations work in 6 -> 7, we can accidentally
mark "accounts" as service accounts when they are persons. This
allows migrating them to the person type due to its similarities.

In the future this will be REMOVED!

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag of the SSH key

get.summary: Get the details of a sync account
get.description: Get the details of a sync account

shell.description: The internal attribute is "loginshell" but we use shell in the API currently

choose.description: You need to select how you want to talk to me.

continue.description: Continue to auth, allowed mechanisms/challenges listed.

denied.description: Something was bad, your session is terminated and no cookie.

success.description: Everything is good, your bearer token has been issued and is within the result.

init.description: "I want to authenticate with this username"

init2.description:
A new way to issue sessions. Doing this as a new init type
to prevent breaking existing clients. Allows requesting of the type
of session that will be issued at the end if successful.

privileged.description: If true, the session will have r/w access.

gidoverlapssystemmin.description: when you ask for a gid that's lower than a safe minimum

oneOf.description: When a name is denied by the system config

ProtoEntry.description: Placeholder until we can handle a BTree in utipa

oneOf.description:
No actions are to be taken - only update or create entries in the
entries set.

Retain.description:
All entries that have their uuid present in this set are retained.
Anything not present will be deleted.

Delete.description:
Any entry with it's uuid in this set will be deleted. Anything not
present will be retained.

issuer.description: User-facing name of the system, issuer of the TOTP

expiry.description:
If none, there is no expiry, and this is always rw. If there is
an expiry, check that the current time < expiry.

UserAuthToken.description:
The currently authenticated user, and any required metadata for them
to properly authorise them. This is similar in nature to oauth and the krb
PAC/PAD structures. This information is transparent to clients and CAN
be parsed by them!

This structure and how it works will *very much* change over time from this
point onward! This means on updates, that sessions will invalidate in many
cases.

expiry.description:
If none, there is no expiry, and this is always valid. If there is
an expiry, check that the current time < expiry.

WebError.description: The web app's top level error type, this takes an `OperationError` and converts it into a HTTP response.
